headline: 'The Five' on VP Harris urging migrants not to come to US

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: I want to be clear to folks in this region who are thinking about making that dangerous track to the United States-Mexico border, do not come. Do not come. We, as one of our priorities we'll discourage illegal migration. And I believe if you come to our border, you will be turned back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. So here we go. Greg, so what do you think of her comments especially trying to warn people off of coming to the United States?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, first off, I want to congratulate you on getting your real estate license.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The jacket looks great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I knew you're going to come up with my clothes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kamala's -- Kamala's motto should be she's not V.P., she is why me? Because this is -- because -- OK. Technically, she is now officially a racist, right? Because how could her saying what she said to Guatemala be construed any differently because if anybody had said that six months ago or eight months ago, because she viewed it through the filter of race, they would be racist. If you had a strong, forceful position on the border which most Republicans do, then you were a bad person, you were racist. So now she gets into power and she sounds like a Republican. She should actually be denouncing herself for her cold, cold stance towards the people down south. And it shows you how -- it also shows you how the media response. And so now if you criticize Kamala about her job, she says she's not up to the job then you are again, racist or you're sexist. However, it was a Democratic Party that threw her out, what is it, December 2019?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like, yes, she was the first want to go with like, 3 percent and who do they choose instead of her? A really old white guy who knew somebody in the Klan. So, I don' know what's going on here. I think the world has spoken, Kamala Harris is a racist and the media had eviscerated people as bigots for saying the very same thing and it makes me think maybe the media is playing favorites, Dana. I don't know if that's the case, I may not have enough data on that but I think they might not have meant it when they were calling everybody racist.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They may -- that's true. They might not. A little disingenuous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. And if you see anything like a four bedroom with a pool if you could just, you know, bookmark them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And do you still one of those -- do you need a basement for all of your ferrets?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I need a basement.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And the other things you do in the basement?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. I'll be looking into that. You're actually right, this does look like a real estate outfit. OK. Geraldo Rivera, you've been in Guatemala in the past, you saw that they were at odds a little bit about what the root cause is. Do you think there's anything that the Biden administration put forth today that would actually get to the root cause?

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: Well, first of all, I am much more bullish on migration than most of the people in this building. I really believe that it is the characteristic of a robust, growing, vibrant country that we take these strong backs, we absorb them. Look at all the help wanted signs, there's an unmistakable poll or you stay there you get two bucks a day, come here you get 20 bucks an hour. You know, so. In terms of what's going on now, the disorder and the dysfunction at the border I think that is lamentable and I do put the responsibility for that on the Biden administration. I think that President Trump was harsh, he was a bully, he took the Mexican president Lopez Obrador, and kind of slapped them around and said we're going to put tariffs on you if you don't use the Mexican army to intervene and intercede and stop these folks from taking the 2,000-mile trek across Mexico to get to our southern border. Biden's message was much more bushy. You know, come, come, it's great. You know, immigration. You know, what I said to start my little segment here, immigration is good. Biden said that's the wrong message for the American president. The American president has to say stay home, apply, get online - -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- and so forth. And as a result of his mixed messaging I think you have chaos now and you have tragedy being acted out in the Arizona desert.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris also responded to a GOP criticism. Take a listen to this, Katie.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: On the issue of Republican's political attacks or criticism or even concerns, the reason I am here in Guatemala as my first trip as Vice President of the United States is because this is one of our highest priorities, and I will continue to be focused on that kind of work as opposed to grand gestures.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- for trafficking which these politicians in Guatemala are concerned about. And today the vice president actually was being protested today by locals saying stop funding criminality, you need a tough guy like Trump. You need tough policies to stop cartels from profiting off of this human crisis. And apparently, the Biden administration has no interest in doing that and taking it seriously. And she's the vice president of the United States not of Guatemala. So maybe visiting a couple towns that are affected by this would be nice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It does make you wonder, Sean, if the grand -- do you remember when all of the Democrats went to do grand gestures at the border --

utterances.speaker: SEAN DUFFY, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- during the campaign? I mean, is that what was happening, I think during, you know, child separation policy and going down there and all of that. But I also wanted to ask you this. So, Biden gives her this charge back 75 days ago, OK. And then she's waited, OK. Now three days ago she got the assignment to try to get the election bill passed for the Democrats and Joe Manchin, the senator from West Virginia put a stake in that over the weekend so she is not --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: She gets the garbage can of all of Joe Biden's priorities. Right? She gets stuck with all the garbage. But I think, I mean, to Katie's point, I think it's important to note that she's looking for the root causes of what's going on Guatemala and the Northern Triangle companies. And if you want to know what the root cause is, there is a crime --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Look in the White House.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: -- there is corruption --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Look in the White House.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: -- and people want to get the heck out.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: And the border is open. So, close our border and actually have people stay in these countries, the innovators, the job creators, the entrepreneurs, if they stay there they will force the political change as necessary, but if we think that we are going to give Guatemala and the Northern Triangle countries billions of dollars and think that tomorrow we are going to resolve their problems. We're not. We're going to get that gauge and so we're going to keep the border open for 20 years and let people come up and into the country? I think we as Americans have a right to say who comes in and who doesn't. It's not willy- nilly who wants to make the track north over, you know, 1,500 miles and come in, you know, on American soil.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think the case could be made that the actual root cause is the problem that we don't have a secure border.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's actually the root cause.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. But I don't -- I disagree. I do want the people that take the risk. Because that's -- that usually --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- that usually is the person that I'd want them to do it legally.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But they're --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Who makes -- like who walks 2,000 miles.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The innovators are the people that we want, too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Four years old.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We want the innovators. We want the creators.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But there's a --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Neither.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I know --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: A lot of bad people coming up across the border --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I agree.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: The drug dealers.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But they make it over the walls, they make it, they fly, they dig, they take boats. The pros are not going to be stopped.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Well what happens to Guatemala?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The walls stops one and --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, this is it. What happens to Guatemala if those people stay? Nothing.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Guatemala is great.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Going to suck up those billions of dollars.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's good to be back in studio where you can have a little argument once in a while. Up next, America has been shaken by major cyberattacks and now a top Biden official says we better get used to it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hey.

utterances.speaker: GINA RAIMONDO, U.S. SECRETARY OF COMMERCE
utterances.sentences: The first thing we have to recognize is this is the reality and we should assume and businesses should assume that these attacks are here to stay and if anything will intensify.

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, HOST, CNN
utterances.sentences: Do you think that adversaries of the United States have the capability right now to shut down the power grid?

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER GRANHOLM, U.S. SECRETARY OF ENERGY
utterances.sentences: Yes, they do. There are thousands of attacks on all aspects of the energy sector and the private sector generally, it's happening all the time.

utterances.speaker: JOHN RATCLIFFE, FORMER DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE
utterances.sentences: There's a gaping hole in our cyber defense and that hole is called the Department of Homeland Security. By law, the Department of Homeland Security has the authority to defend our networks against domestic attacks but authority is not capability. And you know, unfortunately, I think most folks in the government stopped arguing a long time ago about this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. You never know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You guys are walking around.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let me grab the ransomware.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You'll never know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As you see some kind of flirty, halter top. OK. So, is this enough just to take the crypto? Shouldn't you be putting them in the crypto?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, in the crypt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, Secretary Raimondo --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- she basically was saying, yes, it's really important for us to be prepared.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. We know that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We've known that for many, many years. General Jack Keane this morning on the newsroom said, that we actually as the government have the capability to push back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERNO
utterances.sentences: So, it sounds like, one, we did today in terms of getting that crypto back but also, it would be helpful, I think if the administration said, and America will not stand for this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's a declaration of war and we will kill you like a terrorist. That's all you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's -- OK, so that was the other point I wanted to make. For years you've made the point about the concern taking terrorism and bioterror and putting them together. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Imagine that, plus the wars that we are in, I think that we are in a cyber war right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because those are attacks against actual people and that's the new war that we are all going to have to be fighting and put all these three courses into it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Putting anthrax or something on a drone and letting it go over a football game --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- it's pretty easy to do, Sean. What do you -- so you know about the bitcoin stuff probably more than all of us combined, because you have some?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I have some.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, what do you make about this new kind of activity, this new kind of problem?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: So, let me leave bitcoin for a second. I'm a huge fan. But to your point, I think we have to be aggressive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: This is an attack on our sovereignty, right? Now there is a role for our businesses to protect their infrastructure and keep them -- keep them safe from attackers. But I view this we should send in SEALS. Right. So you have, you know, 22-year-old kids in their pajamas in their basement doing their thing on their computer, SEAL show up, boom, boom, boom, guess what? No more attacks. Right? They can do it, right, they can attack us but they won't because they'll get, you know, a knock into the head.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Right? And that's the way you stop these attacks on in our country. And frankly, I don't think Putin is going to play ball. Putin is not going to hold these hackers accountable. So it's going to be the U.S. government that holds these little bad actors and these little pods in these dirty little countries accountable for what they're doing to our country. By the way, this is a real risk. You shut down our electric grid, people die. I mean, it's really serious.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, absolutely. But there must be something that Putin can get from us, like that pipeline. I mean, that was interesting timing that the pipeline all of a sudden was -- it was OK to have that, what it's called, crosswinds or whatever.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Nord Stream.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nord Stream. It sounds like a camper. But anyway, so that happened. Geraldo, if we could tie these attacks to white supremacist would the White House act faster --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Or immigration. Tie it to immigration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But, you know, yesterday was June 6 and you commemorated the 77th anniversary of the D-Day, storming of D-Day. This is war. This is war as much as that was war.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, it's bio, it's germ, it's all this -- and bitcoin is so untraceable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Bitcoin was made for criminals, with all due respect to our esteem colleague.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sean, he just called you a criminal.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I just think that it's nuts, they should have bitcoin that explode and leave like it die on the hands of the users the way some back deposits do. But I think it's very troubling and I don't know what the hell to do about it and I can't even figure out my password.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's password.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's just an Ab123456.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But I fear for the future unless we take the pajama wearing kids and set them loose to defend us rather to attack us?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, Katie, I always notice a trend with Dems, the Democrats, when they say a problem is here to stay.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's the one they can't fix.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They've never said that about climate change or any other thing or it's systemic racism.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you said to them, you know, systemic racism is here to stay.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They'd be like, no, it's not. We have to do everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It sounds like there's a group of people that need to learn to code so that they can help --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- the country --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- combat cyberattacks and that's something that the government needs. But this argument of saying, we just need to get used to being attacked is so antithetical to what the federal government job is. The left and Democrats think the federal government has a role to everything but when it comes to problems that they maybe want to downplay expectations for if we get attacked again, they say, well, just get used to doing it. But think of it as, it's hard to think of it in a tangible way because it's digital, but say we had an oil tanker that was attacked off of the coast of Somalia by pirates and terrorists, right? The company would hire security but the government, the United States military would then take on projects --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- projects to get rid of terrorists who were attacking U.S. interests whether they are private --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- or military targets no matter where they are in the world. We've seen this, you know, all over the place, Africa.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Us produce a private citizen and we still go try to save them.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Exactly. So, the government has an obligation to fight this from a level of military force and sending in some navy SEALS or some delta force guys, it might send the right message to these people to not carry out terrorist attacks especially on critical infrastructure here in the states. And when it comes to Putin, I think that the attack on the meat-packing company happened actually after Nord Stream 2 was pushed through.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, it doesn't matter.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And so, it doesn't really matter --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- unless there's force involve that there is a consequence from the government and not just a security from a private company, it's going to keep happening.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The biggest problem is insurance. It's cheaper for the companies - -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Companies, yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- to pay the ransom because they are insured.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You got to outlaw that insurance. That's how you get them to do it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But it might be less expensive if they actually invested in protecting their systems in the first place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Amen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. But that's the way they do. They weigh the best cost and benefits --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- and they think it's cheaper. Meanwhile, what if we -- what if it's you that is being extorted? Like you have --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I've been thinking about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like, let's -- you're thinking about those you took back in the '90s? They're up in the cloud. They're up in the cloud. Somebody gets a hold of it could be a person to person extortion thing.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like, if a kid gets extorted, is he going to tell his parents that they're -- no. He's going to -- if he's going to freak out, he could harm himself, that's what scares me is that that can happen more and more. Not that I have anything on the cloud.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: That's only $20 and the allowance --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: The bitcoin, I know the bitcoin. That's worth more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Up next, major backlash after a speaker at Yale says that she fantasizes about killing white people or two.

utterances.speaker: ARUNA KHILANANI, PSYCHIATRIST
utterances.sentences: I had fantasies of unloading a revolver into the head of any white person that got in my way, burying their body and wiping my bloody hands as I walked away relatively guiltiness with a bounce in my step. Like I the world a (muted) favor. White people are out of their minds and they have been for a long time. We are asking a demented, violent predator who thinks that they are a saint or a superhero, to accept responsibility. It's not going to happen. They have five holes in their brain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. So, this class that she was teaching was one that would allow you to get your licensing credit, so it was one of the ones that you had to take. So, this is the kind of thing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Allowed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- that is allowed, right. So, if you wanted to become a psychiatrist you could go to this lecture and take her class. As I read that entire interview that she did with Barry Weiss and I have to say, like, to me, I'm not a psychiatrist obviously but I would say this person is insane. And the fact that Yale tried to suppress views, (AUDIO GAP), like, is that censorship?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (AUDIO GAP) That they knew that it could cause them a big problem. I can't imagine that they want this kind of person there. Now some people might say, that's just one lady. It's just one crazy -- it's just one lady and it's not representative.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It's ill.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But when you think about how much we are all talking in the country about critical race theory --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and curriculum that's being suggested for school districts all across the country like this type of thing is happening in the universities, then where do they go next?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They graduate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. She makes a point that, you know, this is the class you can take for credits, well that means that you are supposed to take what she is saying seriously. And as if this is something that should be credible in terms of an argument. But Geraldo, basically what she's saying is you're allowed to murder white people for the sake of them being white. It sounds pretty racist to me.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I'll leave white people.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Is it racist? Is it racist? Is it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What you mean we?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: First of all, this absolutely confirms my theory that all psychiatrists are crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You just -- now you just smeared a whole group based on --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I did. I did. I smear the whole group.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But you won't answer my question.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, this is -- this casual hatred is very, very troubling. And it underlies a lot of vibe that's out there right now where you have -- talking about critical race theory, you have critical race relations going on all over the place, this one to that one and this one to that one. I think it's very, very troubling. I was a fellow at Yale, Calhoun College named after Senator John C. Calhoun from, you know, the early 19th century who was a racist, apparently. John Kennedy said he was one of the great senators ever. But they rediscovered that he was a racist a few years ago. And so, they changed the name of Calhoun College where I was a Calhoun fellow. And you know, I quit. I quit because it was so gratuitous. It was so -- they were so politically correct. And to launch this person, and then attempt to cover it up -- it's never the crime. It's always the cover-up. They got -- they got -- and I say that I have a beautiful third-year law student at Yale, my daughter. I'm very proud of the association, but this woman is nuts.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, when Dana says -- it is how many minds has she touched? That end up in your human resources department, right, or in public relations? And the goal, without question, is to create a race war. This language isn't about uniting a country, it's about splitting it and making sure that it ends violently. Can you imagine having her as -- you know, she has patients. She actually has. Could you imagine if she was your analyst, because she's actually talking about her white patients publicly. And she was not using their names, but lumping them in and describing them as guilt-ridden, bred rejecting freaks, which is when you -- when you generically apply like a certain kind of identity to a group that's negative, that's racist. She was basically demeaning all of her white patients. Imagine how quickly a white MD would be disbarred if he had politically -- publicly, I'm sorry, smeared his Black patients. If he got up there and says, you know, the problem with my Black patients, A, B, C, and D, that person would be a net would be naturally scorned. This backlash that she's experienced experiencing now isn't even a backlash. It's us talking about it while Yale covers it up. She confessed - - by the way, in this -- her defense about it being out of context. What she's trying to say is that she once I believe was a person so consumed with anger, and that she's confessing it now, she's (AUDIO GAP) people so much. The context, the problem is she identifies a problem, but not the source. And her source is the obsession with race. The more people become obsessed with race, the more of this delusion and antipathy and hatred will spread and it's demonic. It's actually when you hear that, you feel the presence (AUDIO GAP) it's demonic.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. Sean?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: So, I just want to make a couple points. So, the name of this speech at Yale was the psychopathic problem of the white mind.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right. (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Can you imagine putting any other race in there? It's insane. So, what concerns me is you have all these little kids across America who are being taught that they're white supremacists because they're white, or they're racist because they're white. I mean, how destructive is that for little children, number one. But what concerns me more is the Democrat Party is pushing this ideology. And they have a long history as racist, segregationist, they supported Jim Crow, and they're doing the same thing here just in a different way. Now, they've switched from Black and now they've gone to White, but this is the M.O. of Democrats, racism, segregation, separation on race, and it will destroy our country.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. It comes down to identity politics, which is now manifesting itself in a worse ideology, which is critical race theory. All right, up next, a center in the sports world. How COVID rules cost a golfer nearly $2 million dollars.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Jon Rahm, the world's number three golfer, was on a roll on his way to winning nearly $2 million heading into the final round of the PGA Memorial tournament. He had a commanding six-stroke lead, but then something truly awful happened and it was not a sand trap.

utterances.speaker: JON RAHM, GOLFER
utterances.sentences: No way. Not again.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What's wrong?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Jon Rahm in tears after getting the news on live television that he had tested positive for COVID and would not be allowed to finish the tournament. Announcer Jim Nantz puzzled by how it all played out.

utterances.speaker: JIM NANTZ, SPORTSCASTER
utterances.sentences: Somebody just gave Jon some news and this is not good. And we have no idea. We have no idea.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: At least no one died. I mean, it was a terrible way, Dana, to present it to the poor guy. I mean, they are he is. Why they even let him play that third round?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, because he hadn't tested positive yet. So, the test apparently comes in while they're playing and they take -- like, massive come in and take him off the -- what do you call that? A course. That's what it's called. It's called a field but it is obviously not a field. I am going to say, I think this is wrong. I think that the PGA could have updated its rules as long as all these other places have updated rules. In fact, even here in New York, the mask rules, all the rules in terms of being open, everything is 100 percent capacity, everything can be back. So, it doesn't make sense to me. Now, if that's the rule and he knew that that was the rule, and that was the risk, OK, I guess that is something. But they hit --- they hadn't had the test before. So, not only did he lose out on this tournament, but I think an additional one that's -- that he was potentially going to play in soon. So, he'll not be able to do that. Now, his statement was very mild. You know, he's -- he was very disappointed. I have to withdraw. I'm very thankful for my family. Thank you for the fans. Now, that's what he said publicly. I'm just dying to know what he said privately.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Why aren't vaccines or vaccinations mandatory for big-time athletes when so much is at stake?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is even more idiotic. This is the dumbest thing to come out of this thing. There -- you are playing a sport that is naturally social distanced and is outside.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's outside.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You could have COVID. You can be -- it is so absurd and so anti- science that he should -- he should sue. By the way, do you know how many athletes play really, really good when they're sick? It's like if you actually --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Michael Jordan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, there are people that have won world series. I have -- my favorite example is Dock Ellis, who Geraldo might remember, pitched a no- hitter in 1970 for the Pittsburgh Pirates while he was on acid. So, my theory is if you start banning players based on this -- on this criteria, no one would be playing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I did THE FIVE. No, just kidding.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Greg, that's not being sick. That's taking drugs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's the difference.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I'm just saying, man, that's some athletes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How do you feel about mandatory vaccines?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think I'm going to go back to the story at hand and not talk about mandatory vaccines, especially since you can get vaccinated and still get COVID just like Bill Maher did. So, I don't know what his vaccination status is and I don't think it's anybody's business to know what his vaccination status is.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, he got vaccinated after he was exposed.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: The point is, this is absolutely absurd that he was taken off the course. It's not just about the money, it's about the ability as an athlete to be playing at this level. They took that away from him. He's a healthy person. And if Nancy Pelosi can bring in COVID positive people to vote for her inside the speaker -- for speaker inside the Capitol, there's absolutely no reason why he should have been taken off of the course especially outside, social distanced. Other accommodations could have been made and this is just an absolute tragedy based on guidance. So, that's been all over the map for a year now.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The dude hit it a hole in one.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I know he did.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He had a hole in one.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: He was up by six strokes. I'm not a golfer. Listen, we should not have mandatory vaccines. It's his choice. If he gets -- if he gets the virus, he loses one point.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: We should have mandatory vaccine.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And he can also get it again.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Here's what I find interesting. In the video, he has COVID and they're all hugging him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: They're doing like group hug and they walked together.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And he's crying.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I wonder in sports, if this -- you guys remember Nancy Kerrigan and Tonya Harding?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: She clubbed the leg. I wonder if this is the new Tonya --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Give him -- give him COVID.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: -- Nancy scenario. Right, gave him COVID. Don't club -- don't club the knee, gave him COVID and kicked him out.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: A bad test, right? You think it was positive when it was -- it was negative.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It does remind me of the Kentucky Derby.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They better check the DNA on that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I wonder what the rules are for the Olympics.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Where did it come from.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, where'd it come from?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They need to cancel the Olympics completely.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Forever?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just because I don't like Olympic athletes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: All the athletes should be vaccinated. I mean, it's --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Oh, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean, it's -- I cannot -- how libertarianism come to play ---

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: What if there's an athlete who's allergic to something of the vaccine?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- when your infection can screw up all people?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: You get a vaccine, Geraldo. If you get a vaccine, I'm cool -- I'm cool and you're cool.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm -- you're not vaccinated?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: No, I had COVID. I had antibodies. And maybe I get a vaccine too. I can't tell you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Up next, Jeff Bezos getting ready to leave Earth for a historic rocket ride into space.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: All right, Earth just isn't good enough for the world's richest man. Jeff Bezos will be blasting off into space next month with his brother. The Amazon founder hitching a ride as part of the first crewed flight of a rocket ship made by his company that he founded Blue Origin. So, Katie, to you. When you look at what's happening here, Bezos, his brother, are going into space but there's a seat that's going to be auctioned off in this 11-second flight. Right now, it's $2.8 million. There's still a week or more left to bid. Will you risk your life and spend a cool $2.8 million kind of flight?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I would like to offer or ask if I could borrow a loan in crypto from you, so I can bet on --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I was going to say, pay in crypto.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- so I can bid on this trip to space because I would go if offered. But I don't -- I don't have enough money. But I would absolutely go. But I'm also -- I mean, I also have another brother. I mean, two brothers in the space capsule. Like, the third brothers got to keep on the family business, right?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I don't know if his parents are alive, but that would make me as a parent --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They are?

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I don't know if they are. That would make me nervous. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. But I would go.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: You would go. I would -- and the crypto has to go a little higher for me to give you $2.8 million.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: We'll work on it, all right.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: So, to the pandemic, we saw small businesses shut down across America. We saw Amazon stay open. So, do you think that these small business owners will hope that Jeff Bezos doesn't go for 11 seconds but goes like for 11 years?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know, but this -- it is a very good point. He's basically flying into space to deliver a 130 dollar yoga mat to a woman at the space station. Because that's what Amazon has been doing every day. It's a perfect metaphor in that like they are the number one company in sending a $10.00 object in $30.00 packaging across the country. Think about all that paper. I should have -- like, we talked about companies you should have invested in --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Cardboard?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But the card -- but the paper companies are really making it because when -- if you look in front of every house, boxes and boxes --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Actually, my house.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And also, the people that are getting it, there are liberals, they're all environmentalists, they're all for green. They don't think about any of that when they're at night drinking their rose, like I am, pushing the button, order -- like, I order one record and one album and It will come the next day in its -- in three covers of cardboard.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And bubble wrap.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And bubble wrap, and it's like --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But it hadn't been in a plane. So, I'm doing all this math and I'm going like, I could have just probably walked down to stranded records and bought the damn thing.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: But your kids order on your account. (INAUDIBLE) I was like, what the heck. So, Geraldo, we got -- we got -- not much time here. It was 11 minutes, not 11 seconds. But you're a guy who sailed around the world I think in a sailboat, right? You're an adventurous guy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I have a rule showing that --

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Would you do it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I never envy anybody except I've always wanted to go to space from Captain Video and Buck Rogers in the 1950s on, I would love to take that ride.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Are you going to bid?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to bid because it's too short. But good for Bezos. Good for him. Here is -- what better, you know, endorsement of your own product than to put your -- not only your ass on the line, but your brothers as well. As they said, you know, it must work.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: You guys are crazy -- you wouldn't go at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Elon envy.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, Elon wants to go.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I want a real -- I want a real answer here about whether you're willing to take the risk. Dana, would you send Jasper up on this -- on this rocket for 11 minutes of fun?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I would not. I would not. We're land lovers. But this is what I think. This is great PR for Bezos.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He hasn't had a good PR for a while. The only person that could ruin this or find fault with it is Senator Elizabeth Warren and I'm sure she's working on it. The person that wins the bid should donate it to a Make-A-Wish kid --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Or me. Just kidding.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And man make that kid's wish come true.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Maybe he could give a Make-A-Wish kid a spot on the rocket and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That would be awesome.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Well, good chat. You guys are crazier than I am. I'm not going to go into space.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not going.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: I'm all good. But, up next, we have "ONE MORE THING."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING." I'm going to go first. I wanted to congratulate some of our colleagues. Dan Bongino and Trey Gowdy both launched new shows this weekend. They were really fantastic. So, congratulations to both of them. There was this one part in Trey's closing monologue when he was talking about D-day and sacrifice that I just wanted to point out to people. In case you didn't see it, set your DVRs for both of these shows for next weekend. But here, take a look at Trey.

utterances.speaker: TREY GOWDY, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I think the best way to honor the men and women who died, found, preserve, protect, defend, and improve this country is to make sure their sacrifice has a meeting. Was it worth it? That's the question for us to reflect on. And the answer is really up to us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I thought about that and I thought it was a really great show. And I was happy to be on the inaugural edition even though I was talking about something sort of weird, and I didn't do a great job. Anyway, I will do better next time if they have me back. Also, Jasper went to the beach and here's a picture.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Beach dog.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Greg, you're next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, I have a banned phrase in a while, so I was going to ban two. My first one is this one, important.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, is that directed at --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, is that me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. I had -- did a thing over the weekend on the Friday show. And I heard three girls say important. It drives me nuts. What happened to the T? Where's the T? Why do people hate the T? It's important. No, I'm doing - - because I found myself doing it. I was going important. I was doing it. When I'm doing it, that means we're all lost. And then I did -- my second banning is this one, leaning in. If I hear somebody claim that they're leaning in -- I'm leaning into yoga. I'm leaning into -- I'm leaning into music, just say you're listening to it or you're doing it. But enough with the leaning-in crap. You don't fool anybody?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: All right, well, I have a very important story about a Siberian Husky who was reunited with their owner, take a look, after being missing for a couple of weeks.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Ashley.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Ashley.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, Ashley is the dog's name, ran away from her home in Savannah, Georgia, after her dog sitter left the door open. She was found in Daytona Beach, Florida 240 miles away from her home. They found her because she was put up for adoption by the Halifax Humane Society after they thought she was a stray dog. Someone recognized her from a post on the internet and called her fur parents. They had no idea how she got 240 miles away, but all is well. And it's important to keep the door closed if you're a dog sitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the worst dog sitter ever.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's really bad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Your name is Ka-ie, without the T.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Important sometimes is an Arizona accent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is that what it is?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Bear down. Bear down.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, I got it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's true. Geraldo, you're next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Erica and I have favorite charities, you know, helping the developmentally disabled. We did a big event here in New York, got home to Cleveland and had, I think, a pretty enterprising idea how to raise funds for Autism Speaks, a great charity. It's nationwide, worldwide. But they have a big office there in Cleveland and in the Great Lakes. So, we -- people bid to go for a boat ride on our boat. We took it out onto Lake Erie. We had so many takers. We sold out the first seven. Then, we took another seven, then we took another seven, and we could have kept it going. But a good time was had by all. We raise over five grand for Autism Speaks and it was wonderful. It's beautiful out there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Even Bezos have the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Only five grand to be with three trips with you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Cheaper than space.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Then campaign crypto, not yet. All right, Sean.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: So, take a look at this video. School is out for summer. You got to wait for this, OK. Now, watch the video. We have a high school senior from Illinois who does this amazing trick. Watch and boom, swish. This is Sawyer Good here messing around. It took him 12 tries. But on the 12th try, totally swishes, dunks it off this swing. So, kids do crazy things in the summer, no doubt right here as well.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Awesome.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm glad -- maybe he's going to get a scholarship.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Globetrotters.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: One for 12?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a good idea.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't know. Maybe. You know he could have done it 100 times.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. It's great to be back. Thanks for being here. That's it for us. "SPECIAL REPORT" is up next. Hi, Bret. Content and Programming Copyright 2021 Fox News Network, LLC.
